sentences.sContent: Sometimes I find it hard to cope.
sentences.sCn: 有时候我觉得很难应付。

sentences.sContent: He coped quite well as manager while still captaining the team.
sentences.sCn: 他是球队的主教练，同时兼任队长，干得相当好。

sentences.sContent: ...We don't know how to cope with the situation...
...it is often more acceptably in our society to be sick and to seek medical help than it is to admit that one can not cope with the stresses of life...
...Some researchers have suggested that assuming the role of a sick person is one way in which certain people try to cope with stress...
...what too many people do to cope with their daily tasks...

trans.tranOther: to succeed in dealing with a difficult problem or situation
